Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk dmraid
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: dmraid bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The dmraid packages provide the ATARAID/DDF1 activation utility. The utility supports RAID device discovery, RAID set activation, and also displays properties for ATARAID/DDF1-formatted RAID sets on Linux kernels by using device-mapper. This update fixes the following bug: Previously, the dmraid packages were compiled with an incorrect testing option. As a consequence, the dmraid tool inadvertently scanned all devices, including any other device-mapper subsystems like LVM, which could interfere with those other subsystems and cause various failures while booting. With this update, testing mode is disabled in dmraid, and all devices are not scanned at boot. As a result, interferences between dmraid and other device-mapper subsystems no longer occur. (BZ#1365810) Users of dmraid are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
